review: The only thing the "2" stands for is the new monetization model and an excuse for Blizzard to move back on their promises. This is not a game anymore.
this game just a rubbish,I can't even create an account,why i play a game in steam need another account,it's stupid!
Step aside Bad Rats! Steam's got a new worst game!

Despite the negativity, this is a good game. Blizzard has made numerous mistakes, making it tough for people to recognize that it has improved. 

I've dedicated 7+ years to this game, enduring its lows, but currently, it's the best it's been in 4-5 years. These are my honest thoughts on the game.

This will be my first negative review on Steam

First of all, congratulations on the launch of OW2 on Steam, which is also the same as its name: 'Return'

That's right, OW2 is back

But perhaps the vanguard will never return

Scam your customers with false advertised garbage games. 
Take away a perfectly made game only to add a pay wall, and battle passes, like were all not sick of that already, there was nothing wrong with OW1 this game has 0 reason to exist other than to be a non thought out and easy cash grab for Blizzard, if you didn't play OW1 don't play OW2, its not worth it. Your not missing out.

I downloaded it for the sole purpose of giving it a negative review. You know your game's shit when it loses to an almost 16-year-old Source game that got it's first proper update after 6 years of next to nothing. Let alone when it loses to said Source game TWICE!

Edit: The game doesn't even run! It just keeps asking for me to confirm my game settings, then black screens when I hit continue. And that's after having to restart it because it wasn't registering the battle net account I had to make.

It's a game I can still enjoy playing today, thanks to Papa Jeff's team, but that's it. You have to pay exorbitant fees for everything else and it doesn't even satisfy you.

Now that it's in the F2P model, you can play until you get bored and never look back. The decision is yours.

I patiently wait for Blizzard's 'you won't leave us because you're addicted, you buy everything we sell without question' policy to backfire in the worst way possible. Because now Blizzard is a company that is crushed in the shadow of its former glory, unable to come up with any new ideas, and is trying to sell only the pieces they plucked from that shadow to its loyal players with hope.

I hope Diablo Immortal and Overwatch 2 are just the beginning of that.
